ITAL 375 Dante's Inferno in English Translation (Prof. Castaldo / TTh 1:00-2:15pm in person)
 
Content: In this class we will read Dante's Inferno, the first part of the Divine Comedy, in English translation, and explore its historical context in Medieval Europe. Besides reading excerpts from Dante's classic sources like Virgil and Ovid, we will look at echoes of the Commedia in modern literature and culture, exploring, in particular, the way Inferno has been used to think and represent the modern metropolis and the expansion of capitalist society. While studying Dante's worldview and the geographical construction of a mental space, we will follow the translation of his work in different media and genres in contemporary receptions, from theater to the novel. 
All class discussions and readings will be in English, knowledge of Italian is not required.
